adrFormatAddress: 248 W 60th St Studio 3, New York, NY 10023, USA

originalText.text: Ronin Kai Karate is accessible to anyone interested in self-defense, martial art, exercise, and community. Bhinda Rajwans and his brother Kulwant Rajwans instruct class with style and care while effortlessly meeting individual needs. Whether in-person, at a park, studio, and or zoom, the Rajwans will inspire your inner warrior and champion. Practice with us, learn a powerful style of karate that is immersive, integrative, practical, attractive, vibrant, and life-long. OSS.

text.text: Ronin Kai Karate is accessible to anyone interested in self-defense, martial art, exercise, and community. Bhinda Rajwans and his brother Kulwant Rajwans instruct class with style and care while effortlessly meeting individual needs. Whether in-person, at a park, studio, and or zoom, the Rajwans will inspire your inner warrior and champion. Practice with us, learn a powerful style of karate that is immersive, integrative, practical, attractive, vibrant, and life-long. OSS.

originalText.text: I initially joined the Ronin Kai Karate class because it was conveniently located down the street from my apartment, when I was looking for a new workout routine. However, I soon noticed that I was naturally good at Karate and our instructor/Shihan really knows everything about Karate and will work with you 1-on-1 if needed and you will soon learn the basics of Karate and self defense. He doesnt teach you how to win in a fight,  but rather how to walk away from one, but if needed  to protect yourself against 1-4 people, you will have the basic skills needed to defend yourself. I have been going for 1.5 years now and  proud to say that I am a Green Belt now and really enjoy everything Karate related. After every  class, the next day by Abs, legs, arm muscles and back muscle are all sore  bcs it's also an amazing workout. Shihan Bhinda  knows Karate inside and out.  The class is getting bigger  and bigger every week. The coolest part of this whole thing that our Shihan told me/us is that our course and style (kyokushin)  that we practice, is the exact same anywhere in the world. so if you travel to Japan - for example- and join in on a class, one will start and finish the same way as we do here in NYC, which I really liked,  Join the class, learn everything, and I promise you wont regret it. In fact you will  really get into karate and a great workout!

The coolest part of this whole thing that our Shihan told me/us is that our course and style (kyokushin)  that we practice, is the exact same anywhere in the world. so if you travel to Japan - for example- and join in on a class, one will start and finish the same way as we do here in NYC, which I really liked,  Join the class, learn everything, and I promise you wont regret it. In fact you will  really get into karate and a great workout!

originalText.text:
Needless to say, karate - same as boxing - is an amazing stress relief. Moreover, it's an art with 2,000-year-long history which you will get to learn in the class.

Shihan Bhinda is incredibly passionate about the art, and it translates through his teaching. He's a proponent of teaching several levels ahead and letting the students decide what they want to focus on - perfecting existing skills or trying new ones, or both. What's more he really senses the mood of every person in his class, and improvises accordingly. Bhinda cares about his students, and wants them to have a good time.

originalText.text: Bhinda’s knowledge and passion for karate is present in every class. His energy and thoughtfulness make every student feel welcome and engaged from day one. Join for a great workout and stress release!

originalText.text: Amazing instructor, extremely knowledgeable and thoughtful. Great place to learn and to grow!
